subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
msgSnippet: I know exactly what you re talking about, Anthony.  We ran into the same problem.  We had to jump through hoops and make our own getName() method that worked
messageBody:
I know exactly what you're talking about, Anthony. We ran into the same
problem. We had to jump through hoops and make our own getName() method
that worked for our purposes.


Todd.


-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
MULLER Anthony
Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 6:34 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method

I talk about this method:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/junit/framework/TestCase.html#getNa
me()

The getName() method is specific to JUnit 3, it doesn't appear on Object
class:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html

As I said, with JUnit4 you don't need to inherit any class... So how to
replace a call to getName() method?

Regards,
Anthony


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kamal" <kamal2222ahmed@...> wrote:
>
> Anthony,
> Maybe i misunderstood , but as far as i know, the logging mechanism
works for Junit 4 as well as Junit 3
> and requires minimal plumbing of old code. keep in mind, that
getName() and getClass are from JDK. and not Junit.
>
> This pattern is in the book JUnit recipies by J.B Rainsberger -Kamal.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: MULLER Anthony
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 7:25 AM
> Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
>
>
> I think my question was not clear enough.
>
> In fact, I have many testcases written with JUnit 3.
>
> Now, I'm trying to move on JUnit4.
>
> But I have the following problem: I used the method getName() of the
> class TestCase. In JUnit 4, you don't have to inherit from this
class,
> so I 'm looking for "something" to do get the method being executed
> (as getName() method did)
>
> Regards,
> Anthony
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kamal" <kamal2222ahmed@> wrote:
> >
> > Anthony,
> >
> > In your Base Test setUp() , do something like
> >
> > logger.info("Running Test: " + this.getClass() + "." +
> this.getName() + "\n");
> >
> >
> >
> > use log4j or common loggging to setup the logger
> >
> >
> >
> > Hope this helps
> >
> >
> >
> > -Kamal.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: MULLER Anthony
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 5:18 AM
> > Subject: [junit] JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
> >
> >
> > Hello!
> >
> > What is the equivalent method to TestCase.getName() previously in
> Junit3 ?
> >
> > This method returned the method name during the test execution.
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > Regards,
> > Anthony
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
>
>
>
>
